episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky historical and cultural facts, including a bizarre scientific experiment during WWII, a unique Swiss wrestling tradition, a colorful fire chief from Key West, and a long-running prank between two famous actors.

facts.fact: As part of the preparations for D-Day, one scientist persuaded another to inhale oxygen until she vomited. They got married shortly afterwards.
The Swiss have a special kind of wrestling trouser named the Schwingerhosen, with a special belt for your opponent to hang onto.
In 1963, a fire at the Curry Building was put out by a man called Bum Farto. It was also started by him, though.
For over two decades, the actors Grace Kelly and Alec Guinness secretly hid a tomahawk in each other's hotel rooms around the world.
